intro: Hesperis sylvestris var. pachycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited sweet rocket, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety pachycarpa is distinguished by its thick, fleshy seed pods, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance.
